messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 1699
messages.msgSnippet: ... house ... On Sunday, my daughter (nearly 7) was invited to spend the day with her friend and the friend s family.  At 11:30, the father came to pick up my
messages.messageBody:
>
> **Tell us a good story of something sweet that happened at your
house
> this week.**
>


On Sunday, my daughter (nearly 7) was invited to spend the day with
her friend and the friend's family. At 11:30, the father came to pick
up my daughter and away they went! She was gone until 7:15 that
evening. She has gone to concerts and galleries with this family
before but only for a few hours each time. Never has she been gone
this long.

When she returned, she was happy and talked about what she did and who
she saw. But that evening, she asked to sleep with us. She told
me, "I've missed a whole day of hugs with you, Mommy. I've got to
catch up!" :)

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 1699
messages.msgSnippet: **Tell us a good story of something sweet that happened at your house this week.** Well, I ve been hearing my son humming and singing while he plays World of
messages.messageBody:
**Tell us a good story of something sweet that happened at your house
this week.**

Well, I've been hearing my son humming and singing while he plays World
of Warcraft. That's cool.

This morning I put on workout clothes, filled up a water bottle, and
removed the accumulated junk and dust from my treadmill. I was just
about to step onto it when my son, who has a sniffle, invited me to
cuddle on the couch and watch a movie. So, I waved good-bye (or maybe
"au revoir") to the workout and went for the video cuddle experience.
Pretty good movie, pretty good conversation. And my husband got home
from work early, so a very good day.

Betsy
